titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Subject Files, Series 3
A Guide to the Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Subject Files, Series 3 FA137
titlestmt.author: Barbara J. Gilson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-10-31 01:31:09 -0400.

did.unittitle: Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Subject Files, Series 3

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: FA811 Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Henry James Subject Files, Series 1.
FA808 Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Correspondence, Series 2.
FA809 Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Annual Reports, Series 4.
FA810 Rockefeller University records, Business Manager, Budget Histories, Series 7.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Subject files of interest to Rockefeller University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Administrative correspondence, papers and reports.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by subject (chronological within folders).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Limited access. Contains some personnel and salary information.

did.unittitle: Materials from the Business Manager's office

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Including early items before a Business Manager was appointed. Consists of materials for meetings of the Board of Scientific Directors and its Executive Committee; some blueprints; some personnel files and retirement material; studies of some problem situations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by subject (chronological within folders).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The following files were found at the end of a series of folders on the scientific staff (see 450. 1), and consist of administrative staff files. They were originally stored in the Welch Hall vault on the 1st basement floor.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: E.B. Smith notes, inventory sheets, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda and reports 28 Aug 86: ck.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Files previously stored at beginning of 450.1 series (see above) in Welch Hall vault.

did.unittitle: Booklet: "Survey of Current Business." U.S. Department of Commerce

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boxes 43 and 44 contain papers about the so-called "Third Section" of the Institute, ca 1909-14. This was a proposal to establish special public health activities, including a Museum of Hygiene, at RIMR. The material in these two boxes was found in two packages in the Welch Hall vault, part of the files of the Business Manager. There is very little correspondence, and the file is incomplete regarding the narrative history of the proposal: i.e. the origins, response, and outcome are poorly documented in this file.
The major report of October 1914 was included in the "Report to the Scientific Directors," Record Group 439, Vol. 3.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in approximate chronological order (many are undated); untitled drafts/mss are at the end of this series, folders 17-21.

did.unittitle: Business Manager files re scientific staff appointment letters

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes material re promotions and salaries. Also includes material re special arrangements for scientific staff on active duty in Armed forces during WWII or those involved in government work at RU during WWII. During Simon Flexner's tenure as Director of the RI, handwritten notes by S.F. (Simon Flexner) included in files.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arrangement within each year by Member, Associate Member, Associate, Assistant, Fellows, Volunteers etc.

did.unittitle: Business Manager files re scientific staff appointment lists

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: One set of lists contain information on promotions and salaries (1940-1955) and the other a summarization of each staff person's tenure at the Rockefeller Institute (1933-1934, 1940-1955). Arrangement within each year by Member, Associate Member, Associate, Assistant, Fellows, Volunteers, etc. Also included is one folder of statistics relating to the location and occupation of former RI staff (January 1924).

did.unittitle: Business Manager subject files re scientific staff applications denied or withdrawn from consideration

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Beginning in 1916, it includes an alphabetical listing of the applicants, located in the front of each year, as well as correspondence with the applicant, their application forms, and occasionally reference letters.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The applications for 1902-1910 are arranged strictly in chronological order and the 1916-1948 applications are arranged within each year by the applicants' last name. [Because some of the material was discovered later than the rest, the years are not in perfect sequence.]

did.unittitle: Business Manager files re staff health coverage through the Associated Hospital Service of New York

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence concerning payments to the Associated Hospital Service's plan, coverage of children and spouses of the staff, applications, etc.

did.unittitle: Business Manager Subject Files re inquiries regarding scientific staff appointments

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Similar to "Scientific Staff Applications Denied or Withdrawn", but less formal (i.e., no filled out application forms or letters of reference).

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: For 1932-1937, the letters are arranged in alphabetical order; the rest are arranged in chronological order.

did.unittitle: Business Manager Subject Files re applications for grants denied or withdrawn

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes application forms and correspondence, along with an alphabetical list of applicants located at the beginning of 1916, 1920, 1923, 1925, and 1930.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: For 1916-1919, the applications are arranged in chronological order; the rest are arranged in alphabetical order by the applicant's last name within each set of years.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence; also includes booklets, clippings, lists, memos, notes, and reports.
Correspondents include Joseph Chvatal, David M. Eigner, David Kirman, George H. Michel, Kenneth Schmitt, and Harold R. Wellander concerning their experiences in World War II.

Subjects include classifications of employees, deferments, retiring allowance contributions (correspondence with men in service concerning their contributions and their jobs at RIMR), the RIMR policy, and the Selective Service Act.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by subject.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Deferments are arranged in alphabetical order by person in group.

did.unittitle: Deferments - People Who Have Left, A-E
Deferments - People Who Have Left, H-W
Retiring Allowance Contributions (RAC) - Brigante, Joseph R.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes booklets, budgets, charts, graphs, and minutes.
Subjects include the retiring allowance plan for non-academic employees.

did.unittitle: Retiring Allowance Plan for Employees (Non-Academic) I
Retiring Allowance Plan for Employees (Non-Academic) II

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence; also includes blueprints, booklets, budgets, equipment lists, minutes, notes, and photographs.
Subjects include the dispensation of the War Demonstration Hospital at the end of World War I and the Rockefeller Foundation funding of war research and relief.

did.unittitle: Photos & The WDH: Its Plan and Construction
War Demonstrations Hospital - War Research and Financing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence and wage schedules.
Subjects include salary increases for employees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence; also includes lists.
Subjects include the War Risk Insurance Act (1917) and the RIMR's bearing the cost of the insurance for the scientific staff involved in both world wars.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence; also includes bulletins, forms, instructions to staff, lists, and statistics.

Subjects include air raids, building wardens, and rationing. The rationing material is mainly routine correspondence between the RIMR and the Office of Price Administration concerning allotments of food and fuel.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Arranged in alphabetical order by subject.
